content: ritsknits design 1 ritsknits design what s cuter than a tiny christmas tree you ask why a knit one of course just in time for the holiday season this little guy knits up fast if you re looking for a last-minute gift for someone or if you re looking for a quick knit while you watch the latest netflix holiday rom-com materials needed 2 75mm double pointed needles dpns yarn needle woolike by loops & threads light fingering 85% acrylic 15% nylon 100g / 620m cardstock or bristol board ruler or compass tape or super glue decorative beads optional gauge 12 stitches and 16 row per 4cm square abbreviations co cast on k knit p purl k2tog knit 2 stitches together pattern notes this pattern is worked in the round with decreases occurring evenly throughout to create a cone shape it is important to use strong paper such as cardstock or bristol board when constructing the cone to ensure longevity of the piece one assembled the finished piece should measure approximately 11cm tall and 6cm wide at the base pattern instructions set up co 48 sts and distribute evenly across 3 dpns 16 sts on each needle join in the round being careful not to twist work k2 p2 for 5 rounds 2 rounds 32-37 knit rounds 38-39 purl round 40 *k2 k2tog repeat from * to end of round 18 sts total rounds 41-46 knit round 47 *k1 k2tog repeat from * to end of round 12 sts total rounds 48-53 knit round 54 *k2tog 6 sts total finishing break yarn leaving long tail thread through yarn needle and pass through remaining 6 sts pull up tight to secure weave in ends using either a compass or ruler draw out a circle on cardstock or bristol board with a radius of 11cm or 4 5 inches draw a triangular wedge from the centre of the circle the larger the wedge the less broad the bottom of your cone will be cut out the circle and the triangular wedge you should be left with a shape that resembles pac man bring the cut sides of your disc together you may fiddle with this a little ensure that it is the desired shape remember that it doesn t have to look perfect it just needs to be strong tape the inside of the cone closed as well as any other weak points stretch knitted piece over the cone et
